item.title: How to Create Smaller Podcast Files That Don’t Skimp on Audio Quality
item.dc:creator: brian
item.description:
Many podcasters assume that they need to have the largest audio files possible so that their listeners can receive the best quality audio when listening to their podcasts. These large files can cost their listeners a lot of data usage when downloading podcasts. Or, if the listener is streaming the audio instead of downloading the …

item.description:
There’s nothing quite like the open road. Whether your next road trip is solo, with friends, or with the kiddos, you’ll need something to keep you occupied while the miles roll by. item.description:

item.title: How to Submit Your Podcast to Deezer
item.dc:creator: brian
item.description:
Getting your show published on the major podcast directories is the easiest way to increase your visibility and reach millions of potential new listeners. Deezer is a French online music streaming service that is accessible in nearly 200 countries and has more than 16 million users, making it a directory you want to be on! …

item.title: How to Submit a Podcast to iHeartRadio
item.dc:creator: brian
item.description:
Submitting your podcast to the major directories can expose your show to millions of potential listeners. The iHeartRadio app is available on more than 250 platforms, it’s also accessible on 2,000 plus different connected devices. This includes smart speakers, digital auto dashes, tablets, wearables, smartphones, virtual assistants, televisions and gaming consoles. The more places you …

item.title: 21 Proven Ways to Come Up With Awesome Podcast Ideas
item.dc:creator: brian
item.description:
Fresh content is key in running a successful podcast. Your loyal listeners want to hear more of you, and new content helps attract new listeners who don’t yet know how great you are! Unfortunately, just like writer’s block is very real, running out of podcast episode ideas can plague even the most chatty podcasters. When …

item.title: The Best History Podcasts of 2021
item.dc:creator: brian
item.description:
Napoleon Bonaparte is quoted as saying, “History is the version of past events that people have decided to agree upon.” Perhaps more intelligently however, George Santayana is quoted as saying, “Those who do not remember the past are condemned to repeat it.” Whatever the reason, we history buffs truly enjoy recalling tales of old, reminiscing …
